00025 /** \defgroup capture Image Capture 
00026  * \par
00027  * Functions to capture images from live video devices.
00028  * \par
00029  * See \ref im_capture.h
00030  */
00031 
00032 /** \brief Video Capture Structure (Private).
00033  * \ingroup capture */
00034 typedef struct _imVideoCapture imVideoCapture;
00035 
00036 /** Returns the number of available devices.
00037  *
00038  * \verbatim im.VideoCaptureDeviceCount() -> count: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00039  * \ingroup capture */
00040 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDeviceCount(void);
00041 
00042 /** Returns the device description. Returns NULL only if it is an invalid device.
00043  *
00044  * \verbatim im.VideoCaptureDeviceDesc(device: number) -> desc: string [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00045  * \ingroup capture */
00046 const char* IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDeviceDesc(int device);
00047 
00048 /** Returns the extendend device description. May return NULL.
00049  *
00050  * \verbatim im.VideoCaptureDeviceExDesc(device: number) -> desc: string [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00051  * \ingroup capture */
00052 const char* IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDeviceExDesc(int device);
00053 
00054 /** Returns the device path configuration. This is a unique string. 
00055  *
00056  * \verbatim im.VideoCaptureDevicePath(device: number) -> desc: string [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00057  * \ingroup capture */
00058 const char* IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDevicePath(int device);
00059 
00060 /** Returns the vendor information. May return NULL.
00061  *
00062  * \verbatim im.VideoCaptureDeviceVendorInfo(device: number) -> desc: string [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00063  * \ingroup capture */
00064 const char* IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDeviceVendorInfo(int device);
00065 
00066 /** Reload the device list. The devices can be dynamically removed or added to the system.
00067  * Returns the number of available devices.
00068  *
00069  * \verbatim im.imVideoCaptureReloadDevices() -> count: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00070  * \ingroup capture */
00071 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureReloadDevices(void);
00072 
00073 /** Release the device list. Usefull is you need to track leak erros in your application.
00074  *
00075  * \verbatim im.imVideoCaptureReleaseDevices() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00076  * \ingroup capture */
00077 void IM_DECL imVideoCaptureReleaseDevices(void);
00078 
00079 /** Creates a new imVideoCapture object. \n
00080  * Returns NULL if there is no capture device available. \n
00081  * In Windows returns NULL if DirectX version is older than 8. \n
00082  * In Lua the IM videocapture metatable name is "imVideoCapture".
00083  * When converted to a string will return "imVideoCapture(%p)" where %p is replaced by the userdata address.
00084  * If the videocapture is already destroyed by im.VideoCaptureDestroy, then it will return also the suffix "-destroyed".
00085  *
00086  * \verbatim im.VideoCaptureCreate() -> vc: imVideoCapture [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00087  * \ingroup capture */
00088 imVideoCapture* IM_DECL imVideoCaptureCreate(void);
00089 
00090 /** Destroys a imVideoCapture object. \n
00091  * In Lua if this function is not called, the videocapture is destroyed by the garbage collector.
00092  *
00093  * \verbatim im.VideoCaptureDestroy(vc: imVideoCapture) [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00094  * \verbatim vc:Destroy() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00095  * \ingroup capture */
00096 void IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDestroy(imVideoCapture* vc);
00097 
00098 /** Connects to a capture device. 
00099  * More than one imVideoCapture object can be created
00100  * but they must be connected to different devices.  \n
00101  * If the object is conected it will disconnect first. \n
00102  * Use -1 to return the current connected device, 
00103  * in this case returns -1 if not connected. \n
00104  * Returns zero if failed.
00105  *
00106  * \verbatim vc:Connect([device: number]) -> ret: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00107  * \ingroup capture */
00108 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureConnect(imVideoCapture* vc, int device);
00109 
00110 /** Disconnect from a capture device.
00111  *
00112  * \verbatim vc:Disconnect() [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00113  * \ingroup capture */
00114 void IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDisconnect(imVideoCapture* vc);
00115 
00116 /** Returns the number of available configuration dialogs.
00117  *
00118  * \verbatim vc:DialogCount() -> count: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00119  * \ingroup capture */
00120 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDialogCount(imVideoCapture* vc);
00121 
00122 /** Displays a configuration modal dialog of the connected device. \n
00123  * In Windows, the capturing will be stopped in some cases. \n
00124  * In Windows parent is a HWND of a parent window, it can be NULL. \n
00125  * dialog can be from 0 to \ref imVideoCaptureDialogCount. \n
00126  * Returns zero if failed.
00127  *
00128  * \verbatim vc:ShowDialog(dialog: number, parent: userdata) -> error: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00129  * \ingroup capture */
00130 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureShowDialog(imVideoCapture* vc, int dialog, void* parent);
00131 
00132 /** Allows to control the input and output of devices that have multiple input and outputs.
00133  * The cross index controls in which stage the input/output will be set. Usually use 1, but some capture boards
00134  * has a second stage. In Direct X it controls the crossbars.
00135  *
00136  * \verbatim vc:SetInOut(input, output, cross: number) -> error: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00137  * \ingroup capture */
00138 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureSetInOut(imVideoCapture* vc, int input, int output, int cross);
00139 
00140 /** Returns the description of a configuration dialog.
00141  * dialog can be from 0 to \ref imVideoCaptureDialogCount. \n
00142  *
00143  * \verbatim vc:DialogDesc(dialog: number) -> desc: string [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00144  * \ingroup capture */
00145 const char* IM_DECL imVideoCaptureDialogDesc(imVideoCapture* vc, int dialog);
00146 
00147 /** Returns the number of available video formats. \n
00148  * Returns zero if failed.
00149  *
00150  * \verbatim vc:FormatCount() -> count: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00151  * \ingroup capture */
00152 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureFormatCount(imVideoCapture* vc);
00153 
00154 /** Returns information about the video format. \n
00155  * format can be from 0 to \ref imVideoCaptureFormatCount. \n
00156  * desc should be of size 10. \n
00157  * The image size is usually the maximum size for that format. 
00158  * Other sizes can be available using \ref imVideoCaptureSetImageSize. \n
00159  * Returns zero if failed.
00160  *
00161  * \verbatim vc:GetFormat(format: number) -> error: boolean, width: number, height: number, desc: string [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00162  * \ingroup capture */
00163 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureGetFormat(imVideoCapture* vc, int format, int *width, int *height, char* desc);
00164 
00165 /** Changes the video format of the connected device. \n 
00166  * Should NOT work for DV devices. Use \ref imVideoCaptureSetImageSize only. \n
00167  * Use -1 to return the current format, in this case returns -1 if failed. \n
00168  * When the format is changed in the dialog, for some formats 
00169  * the returned format is the preferred format, not the current format. \n
00170  * This will not affect color_mode of the capture image. \n
00171  * Returns zero if failed.
00172  *
00173  * \verbatim vc:SetFormat([format: number]) -> error: boolean | format: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00174  * \ingroup capture */
00175 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureSetFormat(imVideoCapture* vc, int format);
00176 
00177 /** Returns the current image size of the connected device. \n
00178  *  width and height returns 0 if not connected.
00179  *
00180  * \verbatim vc:GetImageSize() -> width: number, height: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00181  * \ingroup capture */
00182 void IM_DECL imVideoCaptureGetImageSize(imVideoCapture* vc, int *width, int *height);
00183 
00184 /** Changes the image size of the connected device. \n 
00185  * Similar to \ref imVideoCaptureSetFormat, but changes only the size. \n
00186  * Valid sizes can be obtained with  \ref imVideoCaptureGetFormat. \n
00187  * Returns zero if failed.
00188  *
00189  * \verbatim vc:SetImageSize(width: number, height: number) -> error: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00190  * \ingroup capture */
00191 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureSetImageSize(imVideoCapture* vc, int width, int height);
00192 
00193 /** Returns a new captured frame. Use -1 for infinite timeout. \n
00194  * Color space can be IM_RGB or IM_GRAY, and mode can be packed (IM_PACKED) or not. \n
00195  * Data type is always IM_BYTE. \n
00196  * It can not have an alpha channel and orientation is always bottom up. \n
00197  * Returns zero if failed or timeout expired, the buffer is not changed.
00198  *
00199  * \verbatim vc:Frame(image: imImage, timeout: number) -> error: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00200  * \ingroup capture */
00201 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureFrame(imVideoCapture* vc, unsigned char* data, int color_mode, int timeout);
00202 
00203 /** Start capturing, returns the new captured frame and stop capturing.  \n
00204  * This is more usefull if you are switching between devices. \n
00205  * Data format is the same as imVideoCaptureFrame. \n
00206  * Returns zero if failed.
00207  *
00208  * \verbatim vc:OneFrame(image: imImage) -> error: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00209  * \ingroup capture */
00210 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureOneFrame(imVideoCapture* vc, unsigned char* data, int color_mode);
00211 
00212 /** Start capturing. \n
00213  * Use -1 to return the current state. \n
00214  * Returns zero if failed.
00215  *
00216  * \verbatim vc:Live([live: number]) -> error: boolean | live: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00217  * \ingroup capture */
00218 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureLive(imVideoCapture* vc, int live); 
00219 
00220 /** Resets a camera or video attribute to the default value or 
00221  * to the automatic setting. \n
00222  * Not all attributes support automatic modes. \n
00223  * Returns zero if failed.
00224  *
00225  * \verbatim vc:ResetAttribute(attrib: string, fauto: boolean) -> error: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00226  * \ingroup capture */
00227 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureResetAttribute(imVideoCapture* vc, const char* attrib, int fauto);
00228 
00229 /** Returns a camera or video attribute in percentage of the valid range value. \n
00230  * Returns zero if failed or attribute not supported.
00231  *
00232  * \verbatim vc:GetAttribute(attrib: string) -> error: boolean, percent: number [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00233  * \ingroup capture */
00234 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureGetAttribute(imVideoCapture* vc, const char* attrib, float *percent);
00235 
00236 /** Changes a camera or video attribute in percentage of the valid range value. \n
00237  * Returns zero if failed or attribute not supported.
00238  *
00239  * \verbatim vc:SetAttribute(attrib: string, percent: number) -> error: boolean [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00240  * \ingroup capture */
00241 int IM_DECL imVideoCaptureSetAttribute(imVideoCapture* vc, const char* attrib, float percent);
00242 
00243 /** Returns a list of the description of the valid attributes for the device class. \n
00244  * But each device may still not support some of the returned attributes. \n
00245  * Use the return value of \ref imVideoCaptureGetAttribute to check if the attribute is supported.
00246  *
00247  * \verbatim vc:GetAttributeList() -> attrib_list: table of strings [in Lua 5] \endverbatim
00248  * \ingroup capture */
00249 const char** IM_DECL imVideoCaptureGetAttributeList(imVideoCapture* vc, int *num_attrib);
00250 
00251 
00252 /** \defgroup winattrib Windows Attributes Names
00253  * Not all attributes are supported by each device.
00254  * Use the return value of \ref imVideoCaptureGetAttribute to check if the attribute is supported.
00255 \verbatim
00256   VideoBrightness - Specifies the brightness, also called the black level. 
00257   VideoContrast - Specifies the contrast, expressed as gain factor. 
00258   VideoHue - Specifies the hue angle. 
00259   VideoSaturation - Specifies the saturation.
00260   VideoSharpness - Specifies the sharpness. 
00261   VideoGamma - Specifies the gamma. 
00262   VideoColorEnable - Specifies the color enable setting. (0/100)
00263   VideoWhiteBalance - Specifies the white balance, as a color temperature in degrees Kelvin. 
00264   VideoBacklightCompensation - Specifies the backlight compensation setting. (0/100)
00265   VideoGain - Specifies the gain adjustment.
00266   CameraPanAngle - Specifies the camera's pan angle. To 100 rotate right, To 0 rotate left (view from above).
00267   CameraTiltAngle - Specifies the camera's tilt angle.  To 100 rotate up, To 0 rotate down.
00268   CameraRollAngle - Specifies the camera's roll angle. To 100 rotate right, To 0 rotate left.
00269   CameraLensZoom - Specifies the camera's zoom setting. 
00270   CameraExposure - Specifies the exposure setting. 
00271   CameraIris - Specifies the camera's iris setting. 
00272   CameraFocus - Specifies the camera's focus setting, as the distance to the optimally focused target. 
00273   FlipHorizontal - Specifies the video will be flipped in the horizontal direction.
00274   FlipVertical - Specifies the video will be flipped in the vertical direction.
00275   AnalogFormat - Specifies the video format standard NTSC, PAL, etc. Valid values:
00276       NTSC_M     = 0 
00277       NTSC_M_J   = 1  
00278       NTSC_433   = 2
00279       PAL_B      = 3
00280       PAL_D      = 4
00281       PAL_H      = 5
00282       PAL_I      = 6
00283       PAL_M      = 7
00284       PAL_N      = 8
00285       PAL_60     = 9
00286       SECAM_B    = 10
00287       SECAM_D    = 11
00288       SECAM_G    = 12
00289       SECAM_H    = 13
00290       SECAM_K    = 14
00291       SECAM_K1   = 15
00292       SECAM_L    = 16
00293       SECAM_L1   = 17
00294       PAL_N_COMBO = 18
00295 \endverbatim
00296  * \ingroup capture */
00297 
00298 
00299 #if defined(__cplusplus)
00300 }
00301 
00302 /** \brief Video Capture Wrapper Class
00303  * \ingroup capture */
00304 class imCapture
00305 {
00306 public:
00307   imCapture() 
00308     { vc = imVideoCaptureCreate(); }
00309   
00310   ~imCapture() 
00311     { if (vc) imVideoCaptureDestroy(vc); }
00312   
00313   int Failed() 
00314     { if (!vc) return 0; else return 1; }
00315   
00316   int Connect(int device) 
00317     { return imVideoCaptureConnect(vc, device); }
00318   
00319   void Disconnect() 
00320     { imVideoCaptureDisconnect(vc); }
00321   
00322   int DialogCount() 
00323     { return imVideoCaptureDialogCount(vc); }
00324   
00325   int ShowDialog(int dialog, void* parent) 
00326     { return imVideoCaptureShowDialog(vc, dialog, parent); }
00327   
00328   const char* DialogDescription(int dialog) 
00329     { return imVideoCaptureDialogDesc(vc, dialog); }
00330 
00331   int FormatCount()
00332     { return imVideoCaptureFormatCount(vc); }
00333 
00334   int GetFormat(int format, int *width, int *height, char* desc)
00335     { return imVideoCaptureGetFormat(vc, format, width, height, desc); }
00336 
00337   int SetFormat(int format)
00338     { return imVideoCaptureSetFormat(vc, format); }
00339   
00340   void GetImageSize(int *width, int *height) 
00341     { imVideoCaptureGetImageSize(vc, width, height); }
00342   
00343   int SetImageSize(int width, int height) 
00344     { return imVideoCaptureSetImageSize(vc, width, height); }
00345   
00346   int GetFrame(unsigned char* data, int color_mode, int timeout) 
00347     { return imVideoCaptureFrame(vc, data, color_mode, timeout); }
00348   
00349   int GetOneFrame(unsigned char* data, int color_mode) 
00350     { return imVideoCaptureOneFrame(vc, data, color_mode); }
00351   
00352   int Live(int live) 
00353     { return imVideoCaptureLive(vc, live); }
00354   
00355   int ResetAttribute(const char* attrib, int fauto) 
00356     { return imVideoCaptureResetAttribute(vc, attrib, fauto); }
00357   
00358   int GetAttribute(const char* attrib, float *percent) 
00359     { return imVideoCaptureGetAttribute(vc, attrib, percent); }
00360   
00361   int SetAttribute(const char* attrib, float percent) 
00362     { return imVideoCaptureSetAttribute(vc, attrib, percent); }
00363   
00364   const char** GetAttributeList(int *num_attrib) 
00365     { return imVideoCaptureGetAttributeList(vc, num_attrib); }
00366   
00367 protected:
00368   imVideoCapture* vc;
00369 };

00371 #endif
